result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:24 AM Defendant Matthew Robert Hall in court.  Attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen Jr. in court for Matthew Robert Hall.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense applied for DTC, but Defendant does not live in Waukesha County. There is no offer as state crime lab results have not yet been received. Defense requests another further proceeding date at the end of the year. Court sets.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. **Rescheduled due to a conflict with the Court's Calendar.**

File not called on the record.
District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Jack Reider, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Matthew Robert Hall in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on June 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:44 AM Defendant Matthew Robert Hall in court with attorney Jeffrey W. Jensen.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Arby's/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.
